event: calculi in both kidneys associated with ureteral calculi
blood and urine samples sent to the laboratory for culture
invasive ventilatory support with endotracheal intubation
loud bubbling sound in the lung
cardiac function detected through the chest wall
diffuse dysfunction, severe functional damage in the left ventricle
sinus tachycardia associated with broad ST depression
elevated amino-terminal brain natriuretic peptide precursor
ECMO venous leading-out end used a 20F catheter
ECMO arterial leading-in end used a 17F catheter
arterial catheter placed in the right femoral artery
arterial blood lactate level reached the normal range
extended-spectrum β-lactamase-positive Escherichia coli found in both blood and urine cultures
inflammatory indices (e.g. leukocytes, calcitonin, C-reactive protein) decreased
minimum serum trough concentration of Vancomycin monitored
black and necrotic skin found at the extremities of both lower limbs and the end of a finger on the right upper limb
patient successfully weaned from ECMO therapy
renal function scaled as acute kidney injury grade 3
vascular ultrasonography and computed tomography angiography performed in the bilateral lower limbs
necrotic tissues of the lower extremity amputated
anti-infection combination of imipenem and Cilastatin sodium and Vancomycin replaced by Cefoperazone sodium and Sulbactam sodium
